storyInfo: Each life is singularly fragile in the face of oncoming war.

attributes.content: Course set. Drizzles observed. Wayside stations will allow passage.
attributes.name: Radio Broadcast

attributes.content: Incoming telegram from Viscount Dawson. They would like to use this journey as an opportunity to meet with the Dublinn representative.
attributes.name: Radio Broadcast

attributes.content: More nobles coming over to our side.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: Don't you worry. The Leader won't deign to make them any statements.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Did they think a simple show of friendliness would earn them a guarantee of peace from Dublinn, a Taran population kept in check?
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: I say at some point, they need to learn what constitutes true sincerity.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: The Leader is still sending you to negotiate?
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: Perhaps I should fritter away some more time, at least enough that people forget about me.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Good to hear. You've made your share of errors by my standards.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: Heheh... well, since you came back to report on your lonesome, I take it you haven't caught Loughshinny yet?
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Don't ask rhetorical questions.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: You hindered my ranks in their search, only to then leak her prior trail to my men. Not exactly a smart way to save someone, in your case.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: And how do you know it wasn't you I was saving?
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: You know, I don't recall The Leader ever saying anything about executing her. Do you?
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: The Leader did allow her to roam free. The Leader also allowed me to deal with her at my own discretion.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: Don't blame me for being harsh on your friend, Harmonie. In these times, no one in their right mind would let a Draco act freely in Victoria.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: Oh, never you mind that. I don't think we were ever that close, anyway.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: And you see, I'm about to pay a visit to that medical organization she was holing up in.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Hm-hm-hmm! Maybe, just maybe, I'll be the first to get her.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Wait, a building in the way? Blast this low visibility! How was this not foreseen?
attributes.name: Victorian Officer

attributes.content: Who signed off on navigation plans? Which team was on survey yesterday?
attributes.name: Victorian Officer

attributes.content: It's too late for the fleet to turn. Check for any presence of personnel in the building.
attributes.name: Victorian Officer

attributes.content: Excellent... Brick and wooden construction, small enough not to pose a threat to the ship's treads. Continue on course.
attributes.name: Victorian Officer

attributes.content: Oh... would you look at that, another tiny mistake.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: There are always sacrifices to be made in war.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: Yes, I gather what you mean. But listen—I have my own sense of 'discretion'.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Loughshinny as a sacrifice? I say that might be too high a price to pay.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: The blood of the Draco still flows in her veins, you see. She remains ever so useful, even with Oripathy.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Yes, I did not bring her back.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: She has no resolve to fight, but is plenty capable of fleeing.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: Further to which... we pursued her tracks to where the old Taran palace stood. The fires within the ruins have gone out.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: Becoming Infected may have changed her Originium Arts.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: You seem to think it was Oripathy that made her stronger?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Heh... of course not.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: She's my sister. It would be disappointing if she couldn't even hold her own.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Tell me. Who's with her?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: A few vagrants. She calls herself the Leader before them.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: Then there's no need to follow her.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Since she has at last awakened, and become aware of her power as a Draco...
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: She will return to me soon.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Are you sure the long-haul trucks pass through here?
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: Aye, I hitched on one when I fled Victoria.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: ...Bagpipe.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: Eh?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Do you remember when I asked you... what the truth you wanted was, and what you wanted to do after learning it?
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: Because you knew things would turn out this way. Most things that happen in Victoria end up as a power struggle like this.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: Mm, you could say... but it's never the same people involved, each time.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: My feelings still haven't changed. I have to submit my report.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: I just wonder, you know... when will any part of Victoria truly accept it?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: What can I even do, personally speakin', to speed up that process?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: You still want to change Victoria, after all this? It amazes me how you're so...
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: So what? Stupid? Stubborn?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: So strong.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: Come on, Chenchen, that's why we've always been friends, na? We fixate on a goal and don't change it easily. Not me, not you, not my leader!
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Ha. Doesn't seem like a compliment when it's from you.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: And I've been thinkin' these days, anyway... who's to say someone else's dream can't be achieved, right?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: (White noise)
attributes.name: Radio

attributes.content: You're still holding onto that thing Fionn gave you.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: Aye. What's wrong with that?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Let me do it... It's an old radio, and I don't want you to turn it into scrap metal.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: There we go.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: ...the attention of all citizens. The conflict in Londinium between Victoria and Kazdel continues to escalate...
attributes.name: Radio

attributes.content: War has... *static*... broken out...
attributes.name: Radio

attributes.content: The Duke of Wellington... *static*
attributes.name: Radio

attributes.content: We ask you make war preparations...
attributes.name: Radio

attributes.content: Yes, I'm driving back. I noted nothing unusual during my recon assignment.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: The office I used for my last identity? You needn't worry. I'll erase all trails as soon as I return.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: Of course I'll accept promotion from the Duke, if all goes according to plan.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: I don't plan to hide it. I'll have abandoned my personal identity and face by that point. Whatever I say to you now under my current guise doesn't matter, does it?
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: I think I'll get off and take a little walk.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: Oh, sir, would you like a wooden doll? I've brought some from a village on the other side of the river. The woman who makes them, excellent craft, bless her old heart.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: No, thank you.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: Alright... excuse me, are you from around here?
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Why do you ask?
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: Er, just thought you looked familiar? Really, I'm sorry, I just settled down, I still don't know the people around here all too well.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: I'm Fionn. Peddler of wares. Let me know if you want to buy or sell anything, and I'll sort it for you.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: I live right there, see? That house, just finished yesterday. It's a little far from the village, but I like it here right next to the road.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Oh, er, there's your car, I see... Do I have the wrong person?
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Sorry for bothering you and all, I won't keep you any—
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: At a massive rumbling, they both turn around.
A huge shadow looms on the horizon, the earth trembling beneath their feet.
W-What's that sound?
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: No. Nonono, what's THAT?
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: An army?
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Yesterday, 400km away, I signed off on a reconnaissance mission scouting this force.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: What are you talking about?
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: All along, I've been of the belief that with his militant vice grip, the Iron Duke is our greatest enemy.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: With his support, Dublinn will incite hatred amongst the population, dragging innocent people into riot and even outright war. We must find a way to check his power.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: Hundreds, if not thousands of lives, hinge upon my every move.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: But as for the moment...
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: He could not let out a sound if he tried.
Rumble. Rumble.
The battle fleet, led by a grand high-speed battleship, sails along its set course.
This is the territory of Duke Caster. She has silently assented to all this, assented to war passing through her roads and across Victoria.
...Flee, Taran.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: You built your house in the wrong place.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: W-Why?
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: This belt remains the territory of Duke Caster. The boundary is vague, and you have yet to cross it.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: The Marquess of Trent did not switch over to the Duke of Wellington's side come the conclusion of negotiations. Moreover, pressure on the Tarans is set to increase once again.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: Perhaps you'll sight those brutal patrol squads again in the next two days. Perhaps they haven't forgotten the appearance of your name in the case files.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: Did he mistake the Duke's intentions? Is he simply another pawn sacrificed in this war?
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: None of us know the answer.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: And if we did, that lone hut would not be built in a wrong place.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: Er, what are you going on about...
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: —Wait, I remember now! You! You're the one who came after us back then!
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: W-What are you trying to...
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Fischer does not answer. He simply turns, gets back in the car, and starts the engine.
Behind him, the sound of the tiny brick hut collapsing, and the plaintive cry of the villager, are drowned out in the deep cacophony of the battleship at the head.
